data.name: Ravenous Chupacabra
data.oracle_text: When Ravenous Chupacabra enters the battlefield, destroy target creature an opponent controls.
data.flavor_text:
"Why do these guys get such a bad rap? Is it the giant golden claws and teeth? The terrible stench? I think they're kinda cute."
—Crocodile Jackson, legendary cowboy

data.name: Ravenous Gigantotherium
data.oracle_text:
Devour 3 (As this enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice any number of creatures. This creature enters the battlefield with three times that many +1/+1 counters on it.)
When Ravenous Gigantotherium enters the battlefield, it deals X damage divided as you choose among up to X target creatures, where X is its power. Each of those creatures deals damage equal to its power to Ravenous Gigantotherium.

data.name: Ravenous Leucrocota
data.oracle_text:
Vigilance
{6}{G}: Monstrosity 3. (If this creature isn't monstrous, put three +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes monstrous.)
data.flavor_text: Hunger makes a leucrocota dangerous. A full belly makes it angry and dangerous.

data.name: Razing Snidd
data.oracle_text:
When Razing Snidd enters the battlefield, return a black or red creature you control to its owner's hand.
When Razing Snidd enters the battlefield, each player sacrifices a land.

data.name: Realm Razer
data.oracle_text:
When Realm Razer enters the battlefield, exile all lands.
When Realm Razer leaves the battlefield, return the exiled cards to the battlefield tapped under their owners' control.
data.flavor_text: The behemoth roared, and the world was blasted free of empires and tyrants.

data.oracle_text:
Vigilance
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
data.flavor_text: When it comes to transporting priceless, delicate artifacts, safety is more important than speed.

"They're easy enough to find. Question is, are you sure you want to find one?"
—Juruk, Kalonian tracker

data.name: Rotted Hystrix
data.flavor_text: Vorinclex had no grand plan. The oil did its own work, evolving creatures into worthy predators.

data.name: Rumbling Baloth
data.flavor_text: In the dim light beneath the vast trees of Deepglade, baloths prowl in search of prey. Their guttural calls are more felt than heard, but their attack scream carries for miles.

First strike

"They don't seem scary, but then you're suddenly standing there in your underclothes without a weapon. Then everything looks like a threat."
—Jarro, battle master

data.oracle_text:
First strike

data.name: Spark Fiend
data.oracle_text:
When Spark Fiend enters the battlefield, roll two six-sided dice. If you rolled 2, 3, or 12, sacrifice Spark Fiend. If you rolled 7 or 11, don't roll dice for Spark Fiend during any of your following upkeeps. If you rolled any other total, note that total.
At the beginning of your upkeep, roll two six-sided dice. If you rolled 7, sacrifice Spark Fiend. If you roll the noted total, don't roll dice for Spark Fiend during any of your following upkeeps. Otherwise, do nothing.
